result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Tarran Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark Tarran Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Mark Tarran Smith.  Prosecuting Attorney Kaylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 20CF745. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer F. Cartagena. State requests an adjournment of the proceedings to subpoena a different witness. Defense objects to an adjournment and moves to dismiss. Motion of defense is taken under advisement. Court orders case adjourned for a preliminary hearing to be started from scratch.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Mark Tarran Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Rebholz has been appointed.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Mark Tarran Smith not in court, in custody in MSDF.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Victory Gardens Initiative;  Michelle M.D.; Meghan T.O.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Mark Tarran Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo appeared by video for Mark Tarran Smith.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark Tarran Smith
Current: 1345 N 37th St., Apt 8, Milwaukee, WI 53216 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2022)
Prior: 5427 West Villard Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Initial appearance scheduled via Zoom.  Defendant is in custody at MSDF. Due to volume of in-custoy cases, Intake Coordinator will reschedule appearance.
